Okay, now I get the context, will create a list of tasks today!
thank you! @U01AKGWGLC8?

1. Funnel dashboard for Good Chop - ready to be picked up, briefed months ago as you know
2. OTP support
    a. if we proceed with current MVP solution, some post-launch analysis is needed early Jan
    b. if we proceed with proper endpoint, we will need support sooner starting W47 to understand how we can analyse the results
3. ~Pre-post deep dive Free add on pop up in Checkout~
4. Two weeks cadence deep dive
Can you consolidate this into a sheet together with @U03UMPD2NNS?
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GqTtNYp7Mn6HL5OYtG4N0oisoRsPnASu97oJu2oyii8/edit?usp=sharing

messages.raw_text:
Hey folks!
<@U01AKGWGLC8> <@U09D8BZ9891> did the Customer Care team reach out to you regarding the unification of the "contact us" page across all brands?
They are planning some changes, one of which is the requirement to place the terms and conditions at the top of the page. Are you fine with the designs? Have you added any changes?

thread_replies.text: Here some screenshots of what they are planning:
Hey Maria, they haven't reached out to me (yet), but having t&c at the top doesn't sound like a good idea
What's their rationale
Legal, apparently this is a requirement.
For HF the page has an additional component for reporting missing ingredients, which changes the perception of this page, as you get the chance to "do something" before you are faced with T&Cs
Other websites don't have it like that on the contact us page, so I'm wondering how they comply to legal requirements. There should be other options
@U09D8BZ9891 actually, https://www.factor75.com/factorform/contact is already updated with the new layout
Hhmm, I noticed it just now
No I wasn't aware and see we also already have it Live

If it's a legal requirement to show the T&Cs then we can't really argue much but I think the wording and placement could be better

I also think this part should be more distinct since it has nothing to do with the actual T&Cs
> You can reach us by phone or chat Monday–Friday between 7:00am and 9:00pm EST, and on weekends between 7:00am and 7:00pm EST.
do you know who the PM is?

Okay, we all agree this should be improved, right?
They own this page now, so I believe we could ask them to do some changes, based on what we all agree to. Ideally we would share with them our proposal.

We are currently not having much design capacity, any chances that your designers could help @U01AKGWGLC8 @U09D8BZ9891?
and I will start a conversation between us 4
let me see if we can free up some designer time and get back to you

Hey folks,
*Context:* The CMA is beginning to create the Q1 Plan for 2026. To kick off the process, we're asked to come up with a high level overview of our Q1 plans this week. On Thursday there will be a Workshop that will go through the proposed plan.
*Ask:* Could you share any roadmaps/drafts etc. for Q1 2026 that you might have?

messages.text:
Hey team, :wave::skin-tone-2:
I came across this doc while digging through some materials. It’s a helpful resource for identifying which groups to request access to for food systems:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NH_q_nhuWs6sdnHd5_eeCN6wgsUfSYfU1INnZs2FgK8/edit?tab=t.0

It doesn’t cover CPS. If you need CPS access, the group naming follows this format: http://acl_scm_ops_culinary.nl.all.manager-staging, where nl can be replaced with the relevant brand or country code.
messages.raw_text:
Hey team, :wave::skin-tone-2:
I came across this doc while digging through some materials. It’s a helpful resource for identifying which groups to request access to for food systems:
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NH_q_nhuWs6sdnHd5_eeCN6wgsUfSYfU1INnZs2FgK8/edit?tab=t.0>

It doesn’t cover CPS. If you need CPS access, the group naming follows this format: <http://acl_scm_ops_culinary.nl|acl_scm_ops_culinary.nl>.all.manager-staging, where nl can be replaced with the relevant brand or country code.

messages.text:
Hey people,
@U01AKGWGLC8 @U07VDFEFBQU @U03TY4YJU4X  - Good Chop is only showing the next deliverable box to the users. So you remember what was the rationale for Good Chop to not expose deliveries coming up later in the future?
messages.raw_text:
Hey people,
<@U01AKGWGLC8> <@U07VDFEFBQU> <@U03TY4YJU4X>  - Good Chop is only showing the next deliverable box to the users. So you remember what was the rationale for Good Chop to not expose deliveries coming up later in the future?

thread_replies.text:
```Short Answer
  The decision to not expose future deliveries was primarily driven by legacy technical  constraints (reliance on a shared "Whitelabel" dashboard) and a strategic  prioritization of the immediate order experience over complex subscription management.

  However, this is actively changing. "Future Boxes" is explicitly listed as a key  feature for the Q2 2026 "New Dashboard Release," indicating the limitation is  recognized and a fix is planned.

  Detailed Rationale

   1. Legacy Tech & Migration (Primary Reason):
       * Good Chop has been operating on a "shared Whitelabel" dashboard infrastructure that lacked brand-specific customization.
       * The team is currently in the middle of a "Dashboard Improvements" initiative to migrate Good Chop away from this shared legacy system. The priority has
         been stabilizing the current platform and enabling core commerce features (like Charge at Checkout) rather than building advanced subscription management features like multi-week visibility.

   2. Strategic Pivot to E-Commerce (Business Reason):
       * Good Chop is actively trying to move away from the rigid "subscription plan" model (which "Future Boxes" reinforces) and towards a flexible E-Commerce /
         One-Time Purchase (OTP) model.
       * Investing heavily in a UI that emphasizes "managing your next 4 subscription boxes" would have been counter-strategic while the business was trying to
         build "Charge at Checkout" and "OTP" flows to allow customers to buy what they want, when they want, without being locked into a rigid weekly cadence.

   3. Inventory & Sourcing Complexity:
       * Unlike standard meal kits, Good Chop's "digital butcher" model relies on specific cuts and sourcing. Managing guaranteed inventory visibility for weeks         into the future is significantly more complex for specific protein cuts than  for general meal kit ingredients, making a "future box" view operationally riskier to promise.

  Future Outlook (Roadmap)
  According to the H1 2026 Roadmap, the "New Dashboard Release" in Q2 2026 will finally introduce:
   * Future Boxes: Full visibility into upcoming deliveries.
   * Add-on Upselling: Easier ways to add items to upcoming orders.
   * Premium Swaps: Options to upgrade cuts in future boxes.```

OK tl;dr I don't fully agree with this assessment, but it's not incorrect; I think a simpler explanation is that when we tested future box display it led to an increase in Cancellations and Pauses making it CVA negative
Got it, and regarding the 2026 planning. Do you know in what format the next box will be presented? Are they planning to use the WL week navigation?
let me see if I can find the designs

ah, ok, not 100% certain of the latest version as we haven't been working on it for some time; but it was originally envisaged as the "weekly picker" where instead of weeks, you see the past delivery box (for recipe reviews etc.) current box (default view) and the next delivery.

There was an option where we explored vertical scrolling as well; but there's too much we want to have on the current pre-cutoff order

messages.text:
Hey team @U01AKGWGLC8 @U07VDFEFBQU
Important info about statsig conversion experiments. I just learned that gross_activations metric is delayed (not sure by how many days). It causes that on a reload, allocation numbers will update, while conversion numbers will stay the same. This can have a significant impact on the CVR numbers and your experiment.
messages.raw_text:
Hey team <@U01AKGWGLC8> <@U07VDFEFBQU>
Important info about statsig conversion experiments. I just learned that gross_activations metric is delayed (not sure by how many days). It causes that on a reload, allocation numbers will update, while conversion numbers will stay the same. This can have a significant impact on the CVR numbers and your experiment.

messages.text: https://www.statsig.com/blog/interaction-effect-detection @U03UMPD2NNS @U07VDFEFBQU
